philosophy.short: Combat is fast, brutal, and decided by position.
philosophy.long: Combat is fast, brutal, and unforgiving. Most fights are decided by position, pressure, and timing â€” not endurance.
philosophy.design_intent: Combat should resolve quickly; damage should matter immediately. Prolonged fights are a warning sign.

attack_fundamentals.short: Spend an action, choose a target, roll Quality.

damage_resolution.definition: Damage reduces Quality by 1 per point. There is no separate health stat.
damage_resolution.the_death_spiral: As Quality drops, attacks become less reliable, movement grows riskier, and morale becomes fragile.
damage_resolution.thresholds: Quality-based thresholds (Wounded, Broken) may trigger effects based on the unit card.
damage_resolution.removal: At Quality 0, remove model immediately. Resolve terrain/death effects (Tainted, Hazardous).

automatic_damage.short: Automatic damage is not an attack and ignores Defense.
automatic_damage.definition: Automatic damage is NOT an attack. It represents environmental or internal harm.
automatic_damage.logic: Reduces Quality normally. Ignores Defense, Armored, and Cover. Only preventable if explicitly stated.
automatic_damage.terrain_rule: All terrain damage is considered automatic.

collateral_damage.short: Explosions and terrain effects harm everyone.
collateral_damage.logic: Explosions and terrain escalation do not discriminate. Friendly models can be harmed if they are in the area of effect.
